Levit''' is a professor of statistics at [[Queen's University]] in [[Kingston, Ontario|Kingston]], [[Ontario]]. ==Career== Levit obtained his M.Sc. in [[Mathematics]] from [[Moscow State University]] and his Ph.D. in [[Statistics]] from [[Russian Academy of Science]] in 1975 (his advisor was [[Rafail Khasminskii]]).{{cite web |url=http://genealogy.math.ndsu.nodak.edu/id.php?id=80043 |title=Boris Ya. Levit at the Mathematics Genealogy Project |accessdate=2008-10-11 |year=2008 }} While at [[Moscow State University]], he was influenced by many famous mathematicians of the era, including [[Andrei Kolmogorov]]. Before undertaking a professorship at [[Queen's University]], Levit spent several years lecturing in the United States. He has also spent nearly ten years in the [[Netherlands]], as a professor of [[statistics]] at the [[University of Utrecht]]. Well-known internationally, Levit has made outstanding contributions to the field of [[statistics]]. His research has included statistical problems involving infinitely many parameters, as well as [[nonparametric statistics]]. In the 1980s, he discovered how to characterize high order approximation problems using the properties of corresponding [[elliptic operator|elliptic differential operators]]. Levit was awarded a D.Sc. by [[Vilnius University]] for his use of [[differential geometry]] and [[partial differential equations]] in statistical research. ==References== ==External links== *[http://www.mast.queensu.ca/~blevit Official site] *{{MathGenealogy|id=80043}} {{Persondata |NAME= Levit, Boris Ð¯. |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION= [[Mathematics]], [[Statistics]] |DATE OF BIRTH= |PLACE OF BIRTH= |DATE OF DEATH= |PLACE OF DEATH= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Levit, Boris}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Russian statisticians]] [[Category:Russian mathematicians]] [[Category:Canadian mathematicians]] [[Category:Moldovan mathematicians]] [[Category:Vilnius University alumni]] [[Category:Canadian statisticians]] [[Category:Queen's University faculty]] {{Russia-mathematician-stub}} {{Canada-scientist-stub}} {{statistician-stub}}
